net.jordaria.gui

Class GuiObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jordaria.gui.GuiObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener

    public class GuiObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listener
    An object in the gui. These have children and can be rendered. All have a reference to the main event system and their parents/children.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GuiObject()
      Constructs a new GuiObject.
      GuiObject(GuiObject parent)
      Constructs a new GuiObject and sets the parent to the given object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(GuiObject child)
      Initializes the child object with the event manager, calls its init method, and registers it as a listener with the event manager.
      boolean getAutoResizesHeight()
      Returns true if the object will resize it's height to fit the parent automatically, and false if it is a set percentage of the parent.
      boolean getAutoResizesWidth()
      Returns true if the object will resize it's width to fit the parent automatically, and false if it is a set percentage of the parent.

      Recursively finds all of the children of this object and returns them in an ArrayList.

      Returns the actual x position in pixels.

      Returns the actual y position in pixels.

      Returns the width in pixels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiObject

        public GuiObject()
        Constructs a new GuiObject.

      • GuiObject

        public GuiObject(GuiObject parent)
        Constructs a new GuiObject and sets the parent to the given object.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Performs initialization of the gui object. This should be overwritten.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(GuiObject child)
        Initializes the child object with the event manager, calls its init method, and registers it as a listener with the event manager. It is then added to the children list.
        Parameters:
        child - The child object to add

      • setParent

        public void setParent(GuiObject parent)
        Sets the parent reference to the provided object. HasParent is set to true.
        Parameters:
        parent - The new parent object

      • removeParent

        public void removeParent()
        Sets the parent reference to null and hasParent to false.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<GuiObject> getChildren()
        Recursively finds all of the children of this object and returns them in an ArrayList. getChildren() is called for the objects children as well.
        Returns:
        all of this objects children

      • hasParent

        public boolean hasParent()
        Returns true if this has a parent object, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if this has a parent object, false otherwise.

      • getParent

        public GuiObject getParent()
        Returns the parent object. This can be null.
        Returns:
        the parent object

      • getWidthPercentage

        public float getWidthPercentage()
        Returns the percentage of the parent's width that this object takes up. The percentage is a float with 0.0 as 0% and 1.0 as 100%.
        Returns:
        what percent of the parent's width this takes up

      • setWidthPercentage

        public void setWidthPercentage(float widthPercentage)
        Sets the percentage of the parent's width that this object should take up. The percentage is a float with 0.0 as 0% and 1.0 as 100%.
        For example: setting the percentage to 0.5f would make an object half as wide as the parent
        Parameters:
        widthPercentage - what percent of the parent's width to take up

      • getHeightPercentage

        public float getHeightPercentage()
        Returns the percentage of the parent's height that this object takes up. The percentage is a float with 0.0 as 0% and 1.0 as 100%.
        Returns:
        the heightPercentage

      • setHeightPercentage

        public void setHeightPercentage(float heightPercentage)
        Sets the percentage of the parent's height that this object should take up. The percentage is a float with 0.0 as 0% and 1.0 as 100%.
        For example: setting the percentage to 0.5f would make an object half as tall as the parent
        Parameters:
        heightPercentage - what percent of the parent's height to take up

      • getPositionXPercentage

        public float getPositionXPercentage()
        Returns how far the left edge of object is from the parent's left edge. The percentage is a float with a value of 0.0 meaning the left edges are touching, and 1.0 meaning that the left edge is touching the parent's right edge.
        Returns:
        how far from the left edge of the parent the object is located

      • setPositionXPercentage

        public void setPositionXPercentage(float positionXPercentage)
        Sets how far the left edge of object is from the parent's left edge. The percentage is a float with a value of 0.0 meaning the left edges are touching, and 1.0 meaning that the left edge is touching the parent's right edge.
        Parameters:
        positionXPercentage - how far from the edge to set the object

      • getPositionYPercentage

        public float getPositionYPercentage()
        Returns how far the top edge of object is from the parent's top edge. The percentage is a float with a value of 0.0 meaning the top edges are touching, and 1.0 meaning that the top edge is touching the parent's bottom edge.
        Returns:
        the positionYPercentage

      • setPositionYPercentage

        public void setPositionYPercentage(float positionYPercentage)
        Sets how far the top edge of object is from the parent's top edge. The percentage is a float with a value of 0.0 meaning the top edges are touching, and 1.0 meaning that the top edge is touching the parent's bottom edge.
        Parameters:
        positionYPercentage - the positionYPercentage to set

      • getzIndex

        public int getzIndex()
        Returns what layer the object is on. Objects on higher layers cover lower layers.
        Returns:
        the z index

      • setzIndex

        public void setzIndex(int zIndex)
        Sets what layer the object is on. Objects on higher layers cover lower layers.
        Parameters:
        zIndex - the new index value

      • getAutoResizesWidth

        public boolean getAutoResizesWidth()
        Returns true if the object will resize it's width to fit the parent automatically, and false if it is a set percentage of the parent.
        Returns:
        true if the object resizes its width automatically

      • setAutoResizesWidth

        public void setAutoResizesWidth(boolean autoResizesWidth)
        Sets the value of autoResizeWidth to the given value. If it is set to false, the object will remain a fixed percent of the parents width. If set to true, the object will reisze to fit on its own.
        Parameters:
        autoResizesWidth - if the object should auto-resize

      • getAutoResizesHeight

        public boolean getAutoResizesHeight()
        Returns true if the object will resize it's height to fit the parent automatically, and false if it is a set percentage of the parent.
        Returns:
        true if the object resizes its height automatically

      • setAutoResizesHeight

        public void setAutoResizesHeight(boolean autoResizesHeight)
        Sets the value of autoResizeHeight to the given value. If it is set to false, the object will remain a fixed percent of the parents height. If set to true, the object will reisze to fit on its own.
        Parameters:
        autoResizesHeight - if the object should auto-resize

      • getEventManager

        public EventManager getEventManager()
        Returns a reference to the event manager.
        Returns:
        the eventManager

      • getWidthPixels

        public int getWidthPixels()
        Returns the width in pixels.
        Returns:
        the width

      • getHeightPixels

        public int getHeightPixels()
        Returns the height in pixels.
        Returns:
        the height

      • getPositionXPixels

        public int getPositionXPixels()
        Returns the actual x position in pixels.
        Returns:
        the x position

      • getPositionYPixels

        public int getPositionYPixels()
        Returns the actual y position in pixels.
        Returns:
        the y position
